alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...MINOR FLOODING THROUGH THE EVENING COMMUTE IN NORTHERN CONNECTICUT AS WELL AS WESTERN AND CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS... At 330 PM EDT, a large area of heavy rain was moving through western New England. Many areas have already picked up 1 to 2 inches of rain, with as much as 3 to 4 inches in a few locations near the Berkshires and in far northwest Hartford County. Minor flooding of roads, low lying, and poor drainage areas will persist through the evening commute. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Springfield, Hartford, Westfield, Leominster, Fitchburg, Holyoke, Amherst, Vernon, Northampton, Farmington, and Greenfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
